info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRouteLagName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRouteLag resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers

Azure-AsyncOperation.description:
URL for checking the ongoing status of the operation.
To get the status of the asynchronous operation, send a GET request to the URL in Azure-AsyncOperation header value.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#asynchronous-operations

204.description: Request successful. Resource does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

mtu.description: Maximum transmission unit of the physical port pair(s).

etherType.description: Ether type of the physical port.

allocationDate.description: Date of the physical port allocation to be used in Letter of Authorization.

numberOfPorts.description: Number of physical member ports under LAG

minimumActivePortsRequired.description: Minimum number of physical member ports that must be up for LAG to stay operational.
